directions:
Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Cut
the marrow in half lengthways and scoop
out the middle. Put the halves, cut-side
up, in a large roasting tin and season.

Heat the oil in a saucepan, add the
onion and sweat on a low heat for
10 mins until soft. Add the garlic,
chorizo, spices and dried herbs. Cook
for a few mins, then add the tomatoes
and peppers. Turn down to a low
simmer and cook for 10 mins, then
stir through the parsley.

Spoon the tomato mixture into the
marrow halves, cover with foil and
bake for 30 mins. Sprinkle over the
breadcrumbs and Manchego, and
return to the oven for 10 mins until
the crumbs are golden and crisp,
and the marrow is tender.
ingredients: ½ tsp each dried oregano and dried thyme
140g roasted red peppers from a jar, sliced
title: Spanish stuffed marrow
